Sequence Information.Peptide Name: C2-1 (CATH-2(1-15) R13I, synthetic AMPs, Arg-rich, UCLL1)
Sequence Information.Source: amino acid substitution, avian cathelicidin analog, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (93.33%) toCATH-2(1-15)R: 33%, F: 20%, I=K: 13%.Activity: active against E. coli ATCC 8739 or 6 resistant E strains (MIC 0.5-16 ug/ml). Warning: other bacteria not tested.In vitro toxicity: chicken RBC: 30% hemolysis at 64 ug/ml.  At this concentration, 40% chicken kidney cells survived.
Literature Information.Author: Hao S, Shi W, Chen L, Kong T, Wang B, Chen S, Guo X.2024
Literature Information.Reference: Front Cell Infect Microbiol. 2024 May 15;14:1390934. doi: 10.3389/fcimb.2024.1390934.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: CATH-2-derived antimicrobial peptide inhibits multidrug-resistant Escherichia coli infection in chickens.
